name: Sheraton New York Times Square Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed with friends for a week here to discover the whole of "New York", first timer in the big apple. Overall a really good hotel, the location is great with a subway station on the same corner of the block. The rooms are actually a good size although the bathroom is fairly small/tight but we weren't there to stay in the room! Very clean, decent sized tv (didn't use it much), although we were out by 9-10 most days just watch out housekeeping come round very early (ie from 7) so put your do not disturb sign on the door before going to sleep. Maybe it was just me but the room doors seem to slam shut very loudly.
reviews.title: A very good hotel in a great location!

reviews.text: Times Square is a easy 5 minute walk "downtown", couldn't be any easier/closer without having a lot of tourists getting in your way. Central park is 5-10 minute walk "uptown" which is also worth noting as its a really place to go and check out. Remember to pack your running shoes. A lot of comments on a busy lobby... not that bad and not very important in our eyes as its a busy hotel.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: The only negative things (not the biggest of things) were no free wifi in the rooms (only in the lobby), bar prices were steep but we drank at the many local bars within a block or two from the hotel, our safe played up but fixed itself by the final day, luckily we used the other room in the party. The lifts can be slow in peak periods.
reviews.title: Corp Customer Service Is Horrible!!!

reviews.text: Would definitely recommend this hotel to others and if the price is ok would stay here again if heading to New York.
reviews.title: helpful receptionist

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from the hotel I would highly recommend you get a unlimited metrocard (we got a 7 day pass) and get yourself over to the highliner, meat packing district, Brooklyn, Staten Island (free ferry), Roosevelt island, DUMBO, Noho, Soho, West village, Yankee Stadium etc. Such a great city by both day and night!
reviews.title: Nothing particularly special

reviews.text: My sister and I stayed three nights at the Sheraton in April 2013. First the good: the location on 7th ave at 53rd is fantastic. We were very happy with the service. We had a few issues and all were resolved promptly and effectively. My sister called ahead to request a room with two beds on a high floor. When we arrived there was no record of her call and no two-bed rooms left. After about 20 minutes, the clerk found us a disabled room on the 8th floor. We were happy to have it. I had trouble with the wifi in the lobby and the barista at the coffee shop was very helpful. Our safe wouldn't open and a security officer came up right away and re-set it. All good. The duvets on the beds were very nice and the window offered the option of sheer or blackout shades (both motorized).
reviews.title: Great location and service but some serious drawbacks.

reviews.text: The not so good (and others have mentioned most of these things): thin walls. I am a sound sleeper (and live on a noisy downtown street) but I woke four to five times a night with loud voices in the halls (school groups I think), ringing phones in other rooms and the like. Despite my best efforts, the shower offered only scalding hot or ice cold water. The mini-bar was too expensive to touch (with warnings not to open it or your credit card would be charged.) There was no place to put milk for coffee, only Coffeemate, which made the in room coffee maker sort of useless. Other reviewers mentioned the busy lobby but I didn't really appreciate how busy until I arrived. The lobby (the only place with free wifi) is like Grand Central during rush hour (think 300+ people). The hotel caters to school groups (which is only great if you're in one.) The bag check cost $3.50.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at a number of other hotels in NYC: Chelsea Lodge, Travel Inn, The Carlton, Holiday Inn Express Times Square. The Sheraton was my least favourite, and the only one I wouldn't go back to. The service and location don't outweigh all the negatives.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel twice within the week of March 29-April 5, 2013 (there's a gap in between because we did a side trip to Washington DC).
reviews.title: For so much money, they should offer free wifi in the room!

reviews.text: We stayed in several other Sheratons before in other major cities and we could safely say that this is the worst Sheraton we have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Great location but poor service

reviews.text: Everything about this property is great - staff (Jade is on top of things, helpful, and remembers your name/room number), location (E line subway in front of hotel), room (received an upgrade). Sadly, the hotel does not participate in "Make a green choice" - here for 7 nights (still here). My AAA rate included free wifi and access to fitness center, else be prepared to pay.
reviews.title: Almost has it all

reviews.text: My wife arrived at the desk after having booked our rooms and were fortunate enough to be served by an associate named Warren. Warren saw to it that all our questions were answered, that we had an amazing room with a view of Times Square, complementary email service and complimentary breakfast through out our stay. Our room was clean and very satisfactory. When we return to New York City we will be staying at the Sheraton again. The bell captain helped explain the subway system and the entire staff has been outstanding. If you are looking for a great place to stay that is in the middle of Times Square and the Show district the Sheraton is the place for you, and be sure to ask for Warren. Thanks Warren for the great service and cheese and wine delivered to our room. We are having the time of our lives.
reviews.title: An incredible hotel in the center of an incredible city.

reviews.text: I only stayed at this hotel for business travel and it was excellent. However, because it was business, I wasn't bothered about the price. The hotel itself was clean and really centrally located. If you're looking for a midtown or times square hotel with easy access to the park, you're in a pretty awesome place. The room was large by normal New York hotel standards and had the most comfortable bed ever!
reviews.title: Clean and Safe Midtown Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the hotel is super busy and can be noisy. This didn't bother me at all but if you're looking for peace and quiet, staying in midtown Manhattan may not be the best idea for you. There seemed to be a lot of groups which would possibly ruin a romantic weekend. But overall, excellent hotel and if you don't mind midtown noise and bustle, excellent location and service.
reviews.title: Great Location, Missing Luxury....
Overpriced Services
reviews.text: Location of this hotel is superb....Times Square, Central Park, Grand Central Station, Broadway....all walking distance. Plus can pick up the hop on hop off bus tour.....

My daughter and I recently stayed at the Sheraton, Times Square. We were in NYC for my daughter's 10th birthday. WOW! Joy, from the front desk, rolled out the red carpet for us. My birthday girl was thrilled when chocolate truffles and drinks were brought to our room. It made her feel so special! The hotel is nice and in a great location. My only complaint is the size of the bathroom. It's probably typical for NYC but quite small when you have 2 females trying to get ready in the morning. Regardless, I would stay here again. You just can't beat the location and service!
reviews.title: Great Service; thank you Joy!

reviews.text: The location is reallt stunning , away from the croweded area Times Square but in the same time you are in the middle of everything...yes , the best area in NYC. I was with my children in a vacation , it was really good to let them go out at any time without fear or being worry to lost their way...no way : ) the hotel at times Square in 7th Ave...nobody can miss.
reviews.title: WHAT A GREAT LOCATION
Elegant Hotel Close to Theaters
reviews.text: Inside the hotel , rooms furniture and cleanliness expressed the high style of Starwood Chain...nothing to say more than Awesome rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service...excellent , specially the concierge and bill captain...however the numbers and volume of your luggage , they will help you to find the suitable yellow cab van to JFK...SO , DO NOT CALL A CAR SERVICE !!
reviews.title: My favourite hotel in New York

reviews.text: Food...we did not have any food inside , even the breakfast...i had a chance to book my rooms without breakfast to have the low bottom price..being in that location worth to do anything to enjoy Manhatin day and night...and who needs to eat in the hotel while you have a wide variety with all kind of levels and taste , from sausage cart to fancy seafood restaurants passing with all famous chain of burgers and pizza.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: I almost hate to write a review of this place, in case it fills up the next time I am in New York. But, I really really liked this place. For a mega-chain property in New York City, it offered a lot.
reviews.title: Surprising mega-gem in the heart of chaos

reviews.text: Great location. OK service (I really only needed assistance during check-in, and, I will say that the wait was rather long).
reviews.title: Wasn’t a great stay

reviews.text: The rooms are much larger than you would expect for this location. Don't get me wrong -- you can't do laps in them or anything. But, you do have a choice of seating because they put in a window bench, and, that alone makes it feel so much more spacious.
reviews.title: Great Location!!! Convenient to everything!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definitely return.
reviews.title: Great location and Super friendly staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lot of service hic-cups for a one night stay.
reviews.title: Good location poor service

reviews.text: Stayed here for four nights, once again traveling solo... Loved the experience, especially in the morning the lounge smells like freshly brewed coffee (love the smell) however the rooms were kind of small. During my stay I booked a trip to the Woodbury commons, once against very convenient, the bus stop was right next to the hotel, and I also booked a broadway show at the concierge, excellent service, one of the workers actually give me different suggests and guided me through to help me pick the show that would interest me the most. Overall it was a fantastic experience
reviews.title: Great location and great service
Great location and wow Concierge!
reviews.text: Booked the Sheraton for its location which is great - not just for Times Square - even if its chaotic and busy! We only had 4 days and this was ideal. Standard Sheraton Hotel, functional but also very clean and generally well maintained, housekeeping gave prompt assistance with broken lamp. Experience though made perfect by fantastic Concierges, Michael and Anthony. They were both outstandingly helpful and informative for every question we had -- it almost became a challenge! Reminds the traveller what a big difference the staff the staff can make to the holiday. Thanks to their advice, we ate great food, travelled easily by subway or on foot, and got straight to sight-seeing destinations without wasting precious time.

Stayed at The Sheraton for 4 nights in a room with 2 double beds. We're on floor 20 and room a bit bigger than expected. Was clean and had all we needed. Bathroom was on small side with a very small bath, but the overhead shower was good, plenty of towels provided. Some noise but mainly from guests coming back at 3am, slight street noise but not too much as our room looked out to a side road and not 7th avenue which may have been noisier. Hotel staff let us know that in room fridge activated by weight if you remove anything but we never use the mini bar in hotels. Menu for restaurant very expensive, we went out and bought 2 bottles of wine to bring back to the room for less than they charge for a glass.
reviews.title: Good stay here

reviews.text: Useful online flight check in available on 2 computers in the lobby near restaurant so we checked in the day before for our flights. We did not really use any other facilities except left our suitcases there after checking out for $3.25 per bag.
reviews.title: Great service, nice clean rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had no wait for the lifts at any time and they were fast too. Did not eat here as wanted to try nearby deli and diners. Overall a good stay and would stay again. Good location as not in Times Square but close enough to walk everywhere. Rooms by the lifts may be noisy as lots of rushing air noise when lifts are moving.
reviews.title: AlohaOutrigger

reviews.text: Stayed there for Wrestlemania weekend with 3 friends and it was a total disaster. First time we tried to check in, our room wasnt ready. When we finally did check in, it was barely big enough for 2 people let alone 4. They did admit their mistake and move us to another room. They swiped my card and said they wouldnt take any money out unless i used room service etc, yet they took $48 out, 4 times. Each time we complained we were told by different staff members that it wouldnt happen again, then it did. Then we were told "its not our fault, its the computer company". No its your fault as i'm dealing with you. Despite being told by a supervisor that it would be back in my account in 48 hours, it took 10 working days. And they still have the nerve to tell me its not their fault, its the banks.
reviews.title: Avoid This Hotel At All Costs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was unclean, the taps didnt work and there was dust on the table and benches. Other guests left dirty dishes and pizza boxes outside their rooms in the morning and they were still there late afternoon. The staff were rude and seemed like they wanted to be doing anything else but serve their guests, the breakfast was well over priced at $35 and lukewarm at best.
reviews.title: Thank Goodness for Zoe!!!

reviews.text: There is scaffolding around the hotel which, judging by other reviews, has been there for over a year.
reviews.title: Great Place on Times Square!

reviews.text: I stayed in a hotel in Cambodia last year that treated us better than they did. At least in Cambodia the staff were super friendly and acted like we mattered.
reviews.title: They came to our rescue!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This would have been a horrible review had it not been for Zoe, our housekeeper on the 34th floor. We had an issue and brought it to her attention. She immediately took care of it and even left us a note and chocolate strawberries apologizing. As an employee of a hotel myself, this is exactly the type of service recovery every single employee should emulate. We understand that hiccups happen but because of Zoe, we are very happy with our stay. We hope that this trip advisor review will get past along to her as she is a top notch housekeeper who took initiative and succeeded in turning an upset guest into a happy one.
reviews.title: Perfect place to spend our engagement

reviews.text: My sister & I just stayed here for 3 nights. It was our first time in NYC & this was a great location! It's only a few blocks (5 -10 minute walk) to Times Square & about 15 minute walk the other direction to Central Park. It's also easy walk to the Empire States Building, 5th Avenue shopping and all the Broadway plays. There is also a subway stop on the same block. As I said, a really convenient location.
reviews.title: Great Location, nice hotel

reviews.text: It was expensive, but for the location & the hotel overall it's worth the price & I'd stay here again.
reviews.title: from my heart to yours

reviews.text: There is a Starbucks there in the morning & it changes over to a bar in the evening.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.text: my daughters and i arrived to NYC to celebrate life. i shared the nature of our visit ( i have an ill daughter) with the reception staff by the name of Tamara. Not only was Tamara kind, knowledgable and effificent, she also ensure we were housed in a room with a view of central park. Somehow she knew this visit would be a special one! i hope Sheraton takes Tamara's sense of pride in her role to heart and has Tamara train all reception folks in her unique way.
reviews.title: Sheraton shenanigans

reviews.text: I stayed here for a week with my family and we shared a room that had 2 double beds. Our room was on the 41st floor and had a nice view so that we could see the Rockefeller Center. The elevators went so fast they made our ears pop! The rooms were lovely and clean and modern with a flat screen TV on the wall as well as a coffee and tea maker. There was plenty of wardrobe and drawer space for all our clothes etc. Down in the lobby, it can get very busy, especially when there are large groups of people traveling together which we found a lot of, however it was Easter break. The rooms do not come with free Wi-Fi which I was disappointed with, but I used the computers in the lobby instead (however as there are not many, you have to go at quiet times!). The staff in the lobby did help us well. On our last day, we needed to store our luggage as we had a later pick up than the check out time. We got caught behind a very large group altogether and stood in the queue for around an hour! When we got to the room, we discovered that they charge $3.25 a bag. Another thing I should point out, is that the mini- bar in the room is sensor activated, so that if you take out or move a particular item, it automatically assumes you have used that item and it will go onto your bill. We had moved some things to fit our own drinks in and when we explained to the reception on check out that we did not use them, we had just moved them, they took them off our bill which was fine.
reviews.title: NA in NYC

aka: Sheraton New York Hotel And Towers
description: Sheraton New York Times Square hotel is located between Central Park and Times Square in Manhattan's Midtown business and entertainment district. Our Executive Conference Center has 11,000 sq ft of premium meeting space.
